critique: The document is an executive order from 1934 exempting Theodore A. Hostetler, Solicitor of the Patent Office, from mandatory retirement. It demonstrates the use of executive power to retain a specific individual in service beyond the typical retirement age. The order itself doesn't express explicit opinions on ideological tilt, immigration, federalism, security vs. liberty, economic regulation, or social inclusion. Therefore, most of the scores will be neutral, with a slight lean towards expanding executive power.
